[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InternalError] [Error suppression] Can a Byzantine attacker craft inputs that trigger InternalError in critical safety checks, causing error suppression that allows invalid operations to proceed? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InternalError] [Panic propagation] Does InternalError properly handle panic conditions, or can unhandled panics in error conversion logic crash validator nodes? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InternalError] [Resource exhaustion] Can an attacker trigger excessive InternalError allocations (String::from) to exhaust heap memory on validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidLedgerInfo] [Missing epoch state] The error states 'No next_epoch_state specified in the provided Ledger Info' - can an attacker exploit this by providing ledger info without next_epoch_state to bypass epoch transition validation? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidLedgerInfo] [Epoch boundary exploitation] During epoch boundaries, can attackers provide ledger info that triggers InvalidLedgerInfo to prevent legitimate epoch transitions, causing consensus to halt? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidLedgerInfo] [State commitment bypass] Can InvalidLedgerInfo validation be bypassed by providing ledger info with valid signatures but missing critical state commitment data? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidProposal] [Malformed proposal] Can a Byzantine validator craft proposals that pass initial validation but trigger InvalidProposal during safety rules checking, allowing malformed blocks to be partially processed? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidProposal] [String parameter injection] Does InvalidProposal's String parameter get properly sanitized before logging, or can attackers inject malicious log content? (Low)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidProposal] [Validation bypass] Are all proposal validation rules consistently enforced, or can certain invalid proposals slip through and only get caught with InvalidProposal as a fallback? (Medium)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidQuorumCertificate] [Signature aggregation attack] Can an attacker forge quorum certificates with invalid BLS signature aggregations that pass initial checks but trigger InvalidQuorumCertificate later, causing state divergence? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidQuorumCertificate] [Voting power manipulation] Can InvalidQuorumCertificate validation be bypassed by manipulating validator voting power calculations to make invalid QCs appear valid? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidQuorumCertificate] [Threshold bypass] Does InvalidQuorumCertificate properly verify that QC signatures meet the required 2f+1 threshold, or can attackers craft QCs with insufficient signatures? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidQuorumCertificate] [Historical QC replay] Can old quorum certificates from previous epochs or rounds be replayed to trigger InvalidQuorumCertificate, causing validators to reject legitimate blocks? (Medium)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotInitialized] [Uninitialized state exploitation] Can an attacker exploit the NotInitialized error condition to use safety rules in an uninitialized state, bypassing critical safety checks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotInitialized] [Race condition] Can concurrent initialization and usage of safety rules create race conditions where NotInitialized checks pass but the system is not fully initialized? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotInitialized] [Partial initialization] Can attackers trigger NotInitialized by corrupting persistent storage during initialization, leaving validators in a partially initialized state? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotInitialized] [String parameter exposure] Does NotInitialized expose which specific field is not set, potentially revealing internal state information to attackers? (Low)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeForOrderVote] [Order vote bypass] Can a Byzantine validator craft order vote requests with manipulated block round or highest timeout round values to bypass NotSafeForOrderVote safety checks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeForOrderVote] [Timeout certificate forgery] Can forged timeout certificates with manipulated highest_timeout_round values bypass the NotSafeForOrderVote validation rule? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeForOrderVote] [Integer comparison bypass] Does NotSafeForOrderVote properly handle edge cases where block_round equals highest_timeout_round, or can attackers exploit boundary conditions? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeForOrderVote] [Liveness attack] Can an attacker manipulate timeout rounds to force legitimate order votes to fail NotSafeForOrderVote validation, causing consensus liveness failures? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: SecureStorageMissingDataError] [Persistent data corruption] Can an attacker corrupt or delete critical safety data in secure storage to trigger SecureStorageMissingDataError, allowing safety rules to be bypassed due to missing validation data? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: SecureStorageMissingDataError] [Storage backend attack] Can attackers exploit the secure storage backend (e.g., Vault) to return errors that get mapped to SecureStorageMissingDataError, bypassing safety checks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: SecureStorageUnexpectedError] [Catch-all bypass] Since SecureStorageUnexpectedError is a catch-all for storage errors, can attackers trigger unexpected storage conditions that allow safety violations? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: SecureStorageUnexpectedError] [Error propagation] Does SecureStorageUnexpectedError properly propagate critical storage failures up the call stack, or are some failures silently converted to this error? (Medium)
